page.title: 11THE CHURCH IN YANWORTH
page.content: Mentioned in{many guide books,}the church is well worth visiting. {Large {barns and the tithe barn}are so close it seems to belong to the farmyard. The{well kept graveyard}has graves back to mid 18 C.{Cast iron monumental {tablets}are unusual in Cotswold stone country but less unusual is the{bale {tomb. Round bullet like marks }have been associated with Cromwell and the {scratch or stick dials }and a {simple {sun dial}are early cheap time-pieces. The {church is mostly late Norman {12 C. with an exterior of fine jointed {ashlar, a minature embattled tower and {a fine Norman south doorway. }Also of interest is the{Norman Tub font, stone {work around the chancel and nave, the {15 C. perpendicular windows and the {fragments of a 16 C. wall painting of {Old Father Time or Death _ }skeleton figure, scythe, shroud and shovel.
